Issues.Title: ControlPaint.DrawBorder doesn't draw correctly
Issues.Body:
The ControlPaint.DrawBorder that takes individual side styles and colors doesn't render correctly:

``` C#
            ControlPaint.DrawBorder(
                e.Graphics,
                bounds,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Red), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Solid,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Green), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Solid,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Blue), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Solid,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Purple), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Solid);
            bounds.Offset(0, 30);
            ControlPaint.DrawBorder(
                e.Graphics,
                bounds,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Red), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Dotted,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Green), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Dotted,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Blue), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Dotted,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Purple), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Dotted);
            bounds.Offset(0, 30);
            ControlPaint.DrawBorder(
                e.Graphics,
                bounds,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Red), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Dashed,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Green), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Dashed,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Blue), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Dashed,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Purple), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Dashed);
            bounds.Offset(0, 30);
            ControlPaint.DrawBorder(
                e.Graphics,
                bounds,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Red), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Outset,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Green), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Outset,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Blue), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Outset,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Purple), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Outset);
            bounds.Offset(0, 30);
            ControlPaint.DrawBorder(
                e.Graphics,
                bounds,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Red), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Inset,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Green), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Inset,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Blue), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Inset,
                Color.FromArgb(255, Color.Purple), 1, ButtonBorderStyle.Inset);
```

Normal is on the left, current is on the right:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8184940/93555947-577e6580-f92c-11ea-98d0-f07280969db2.png)

Dotted and dashed are ok, the others are missing the lower right pixel. This is an artifact of GDI not ending on the same pixel as GDI+. This is more obvious when widths are greater than 1:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8184940/93557172-294e5500-f92f-11ea-9e19-eb8956268504.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ControlPaint.DrawBorder doesn't draw correctly" (#3945)

Issues.Title: Fix rendering of NumericUpDown control (#3939)
Issues.Body:
#### Port of #3939 to RC2

GDI and GDI+ don't end their lines and rectangles on the same pixel. Lines end on the prior pixel and rectangles draw the right and bottom one pixel over. This wasn't caught at first as the color behind the control just happened to match the default on first render.

- Fix the GDI coordinates to match the GDI+ rendering
- Remove the GDI+ fork as it is impossible to set a transparent background color for NumericUpDown
- Add initial rendering tests

Validated with A/B testing between 3.1 and 5.0 with a loud background color. Validated with and without visual styles, enabled and disabled, and with different border styles.

Fixes #3931


## Proposed changes

- Correct GDI rendering for NumericUpDown
- Remove unhittable GDI+ branches

## Customer Impact

- Without this you get whatever random garbage is behind the form around the edges of the control

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Low

## Screenshots

### Before

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8184940/93525609-2d588380-f8eb-11ea-9bbd-991c70a5e4d8.png)

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8184940/93525658-3d706300-f8eb-11ea-9aff-b2096901ac1b.png)

## Test methodology

- Manual validation of various rendering knobs between 3.1 and 5.0
- Added rendering tests where possible
- Ran a number of low-level line drawing tests to compare GDI/GDI+

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/3942)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix rendering of NumericUpDown control (#3939)" (#3942)

Issues.Title: Fix rendering of NumericUpDown control
Issues.Body:
GDI and GDI+ don't end their lines and rectangles on the same pixel. Lines end on the prior pixel and rectangles draw the right and bottom one pixel over. This wasn't caught at first as the color behind the control just happened to match the default on first render.

- Fix the GDI coordinates to match the GDI+ rendering
- Remove the GDI+ fork as it is impossible to set a transparent background color for NumericUpDown
- Add initial rendering tests

Validated with A/B testing between 3.1 and 5.0 with a loud background color. Validated with and without visual styles, enabled and disabled, and with different border styles.

Fixes #3931


## Proposed changes

- Correct GDI rendering for NumericUpDown
- Remove unhittable GDI+ branches

## Customer Impact

- Without this you get whatever random garbage is behind the form around the edges of the control

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Low

## Screenshots

### Before

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8184940/93525609-2d588380-f8eb-11ea-9bbd-991c70a5e4d8.png)

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8184940/93525658-3d706300-f8eb-11ea-9aff-b2096901ac1b.png)

## Test methodology

- Manual validation of various rendering knobs between 3.1 and 5.0
- Added rendering tests where possible
- Ran a number of low-level line drawing tests to compare GDI/GDI+

Issues.Title: NumericUpDown drawing issue
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .Net 5 RC1 (also reproducible with RC2)
.NET SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   5.0.100-rc.1.20452.10
 Commit:    473d1b592e

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.19041

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**Problem description:**

standard NumericUpDown draws some garbage around the text area. Here are 2 examples:
at runtime:
![NumericUpDown](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19591075/93373371-ad8cd380-f86e-11ea-88d7-8170d76c5274.jpg)
in VS designer:
![NumericUpDown1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19591075/93373386-b087c400-f86e-11ea-8f57-dfac59935dac.jpg)
The actual appearance might be different, sometimes it looks not like lines, but as a part of some underlying text.

**Expected behavior:**
No artifacts, only text, borders and buttons

**Minimal repro:**

- place NumericUpDown to the form
- run application
- collapse application window to tray
- restore application window - you should see artifacts
- if you don't see artifacts on the previous step, collapse app window again, open some other application windows so that they cover desktop and then restore your app window. You should see artifacts. If you had your form opened in VS designer, then you should see bad effects in VS designer as well
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NumericUpDown drawing issue" (#3931)

Issues.Title: Layout issue with Label resizing and "Application.SetHighDpiMode(HighDpiMode.PerMonitorV2)"
Issues.Body:
Attached is a WinForms sample which runs both with .NET framework 4.6 and .NETCore 3.1 (open solution "LayoutTest.sln" for 4.6 and "LayoutTestCore.sln" for .NET Core 3.1).
[LayoutTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5241353/LayoutTest.zip)

It contains a form with a PictureBox an a Label. When setting an image to the PictureBox, I move and resize the PictureBox and the Label.

With .NET framework 4.6, it works fine (Screenshot, upper part).
With .NET Core 3.1, the label jumps to a negative location and thus overlaps the Picturebox (lower part of screenshot)

![layouterror](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/138049/93515304-a9bd8780-f928-11ea-94ec-3cabcf28f53a.png)

It does not happen it I call "SuspendLayout" before changing the Location and "ResumeLayout" after the change.

The sample applies "SystemFonts.MessageBoxFont"  and sets the "AutoScaleMode" of "FormWait" in "OnLoad" - this was the way to develop a dpi aware app in the old days, before better dpi awareness modes were introduced in 4.5 and 4.7.
The .NETCore 3.1 version also calls "Application.SetHighDpiMode(HighDpiMode.PerMonitorV2)".

The issue also occurs with .NET Framework 4.8 dpi awareness by adding this to app.config:
  <System.Windows.Forms.ApplicationConfigurationSection>
    <add key="DpiAwareness" value="PerMonitorV2" />
  </System.Windows.Forms.ApplicationConfigurationSection>

Hope this is the right place to report this kind of issue. Maybe, it is a "user bug", but I don't understand why the label jumps to a negative location if I move the left edge to the left by code.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Layout issue with Label resizing and "Application.SetHighDpiMode(HighDpiMode.PerMonitorV2)"" (#3937)

Issues.Title: Review use of `BC41004` warning
Issues.Body:
The latest changes from dotnet/runtime (https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/3804) couldn't be merged due to build failures:
```
##[error]src\Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms\src\Microsoft\VisualBasic\Devices\Network.vb(822,20): error BC41004: (NETCORE_ENGINEERING_TELEMETRY=Build) First statement of this 'Sub New' should be an explicit call to 'MyBase.New' or 'MyClass.New' because the 'Public Overloads Sub New()' in the base class 'WebClient' of 'WebClientExtended' is marked obsolete: 'Use HttpClient instead.'
```

The error was suppressed in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/3804/commits/590399f903a2bc5a3ac8ef5644e3337b0b0f1179.

The suppression needs to be reviewed, and corrected.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Review use of `BC41004` warning" (#3936)

Issues.Title: The PropertyGrid displays properties of selected object incorrectly with Net 5.0 Windows app (Core)
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.NET SDK 5.0.100-preview.7.20417.9

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**Problem description:**

The PropertyGrid displays properties of selected object incorrectly in Net 5.0 app. But display correctly with Net 4.5.2 or Net Core 3.1 version. The used VS version is 16.8.0 Preview 2.1.
Sample code:
  `private void Form1_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)`
  `{`
        `propertyGrid1.SelectedObject = new Font(DefaultFont.FontFamily, 15);`
        `propertyGrid1.Refresh();`
  `}`

Result:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13590421/93308182-24ed4380-f82c-11ea-91f0-826e4c4aac53.png)

**Expected behavior:**
The PropertyGrid in Net 5.0 app display all properties of selected object.

**Minimal repro:**
1. Run attached app:
   [TestPropertyGrid.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5230658/TestPropertyGrid.zip)

2. Observe:
  PropertyGrid display properties of selected object.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The PropertyGrid displays properties of selected object incorrectly with Net 5.0 Windows app (Core)" (#3919)

Issues.Title: An error pops up after clicking the smart tag of ToolStrip/MenuStrip/StatusStrip/TreeView/PictureBox controls
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.23

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More Info**

1. This is a regression issue, it recurs when installing .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.23 from https://github.com/dotnet/installer and app targets to .NET 5.0.
2. This issue cannot reproduce on .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20464.22.
3. This issue cannot reproduce on VS comes with .NET 5.0 rc1 and app target .NET 3.1.

**Problem description:**
User try to show the Tasks dialog to modify some properties using smart tag, but an error pops up after clicking the smart tag button.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/93316911-5f141080-f83f-11ea-80da-f0ceb56e2b09.png)

**Expected behavior:**
The Controls' Tasks dialog should be shown normally.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/93317276-dc3f8580-f83f-11ea-9d16-7fda747e7e8c.png)

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create a winforms core project.
2. Drag and drop a ToolStrip control to form designer.
3. Click the smart tag in the top right corner of the ToolStrip control.

**Error Logging**
[02:17:04.3919896] REQUEST FAILURES: Types/GetEditor
                   Microsoft.VisualStudio.WinForms.RemoteClient.DesignToolsServerException: The type initializer for 'WinFormsSurface.Handlers.Types.GetEditorHandler' threw an exception. ---> Microsoft.VisualStudio.WinForms.RemoteClient.DesignToolsServerException: Could not load type 'System.Drawing.Design.BitmapEditor' from assembly 'System.Windows.Forms.Design.Editors, Version=5.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a'.
                      --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "An error pops up after clicking the smart tag of ToolStrip/MenuStrip/StatusStrip/TreeView/PictureBox controls" (#3927)

Issues.Title: VS crash and restart after clicking the smart tag of ImageList/ContextMenuStrip controls in Component Tray
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.23

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More Info**

1. This is a regression issue, it recurs when installing .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.23 from https://github.com/dotnet/installer and app targets to .NET 5.0.
2. This issue cannot reproduce on .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20464.22.
3. This issue cannot reproduce on VS comes with .NET 5.0 rc1 and app target .NET 3.1.

**Problem description:**
User try to show the Tasks dialog to modify some properties using smart tag, but VS crash and restart after clicking the smart tag button.
![Issue2steps1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/93318971-e793b080-f841-11ea-97db-bf5c55457c84.gif)

**Call Stack:**
[Call Stack.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5231450/Call.Stack.txt)

**Expected behavior:**
The Tasks dialog should be shown normally and VS shouldn’t crash.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/93317437-127d0500-f840-11ea-9cf1-98e104363771.png)

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create a winforms core project.
2. Drag and drop a ImageList control
3. Click the smart tag of it in Component tray.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "VS crash and restart after clicking the smart tag of ImageList/ContextMenuStrip controls in Component Tray" (#3926)

Issues.Title: VS is restarting when clicking “Add” button in ListViewItem Collection Editor
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.34

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More info:**

1. This is a regression issue, it cannot reproduce on .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20464.22 build.
2. This issue also occurs when clicking “Add” button in ListViewGroup Collection Editor and ColumnHeader Collection Editor.
3. This issue cannot reproduce on VS comes with .NET 5.0 rc1 and app target .NET 3.1.

**Problem description:**
When clicking “Add” button in ListViewItem Collection Editor, VS restarts. 
[CallStack.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5231207/CallStack.txt)
![EditItemsRepro](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54019172/93319112-14e05e80-f842-11ea-8c01-bc7fea1507e2.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
When clicking “Add” button in ListViewItem Collection Editor, VS works well .

**Minimal repro:**
1.	Create a WinForms .Net Core application and change the target framework to .NET 5.0
2.	Drag and drop a ListView to the form designer
3.	Right-click on this ListView control, then click Edit Items
4.	In ListViewItem Collection Editor, click Add button
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "VS is restarting when clicking “Add” button in ListViewItem Collection Editor" (#3928)

Issues.Title: Some properties are grey with black rectangle in Properties window after choosing more controls
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.23

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More info:**

1. This is a regression issue, it cannot repro on  .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20464.22
2. After step3, click "Events" icon in Properties Browser window, vs crash.  Below is CallStack: [CallStack.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5231274/CallStack.txt)


**Problem description:**
Some properties are grey with black rectangle in Properties window after choosing more controls. Please see following screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54019172/93313783-7e10a380-f83b-11ea-919d-509b95da62c4.png)

**Expected behavior:**
They are enabled properties after choosing more controls. Please see following screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54019172/93313957-bca65e00-f83b-11ea-9207-30f544ca2237.png)

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create a WinForms .Net Core application
2. Add two TreeView controls to form designer
3. Choose these 2 controls, then go to VS properties window to observe all properties
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Some properties are grey with black rectangle in Properties window after choosing more controls" (#3923)

Issues.Title: VS is restarting when opening the Items Collection Editor
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 
.NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.34

* More info:
1. This is a regression issue, it cannot reproduce on .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20464.22 build.
2. ContextMenuStrip, StatusStrip, ToolStrip controls also can repro this issue.

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**Problem description:**
VS restarts when opening the Items Collection Editor by click Edit Items on MenuStrip.

**Call Stack:**
[callStack.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5231136/callStack.txt)

**Expected behavior:**
Items Collection Editor dialog should show up.

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create a WinForms .Net Core application and change the target framework to .NET 5.0
2. Drag and drop a MenuStrip to the form designer
3. Right-click on the MenuStrip control, then click Edit Items
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "VS is restarting when opening the Items Collection Editor" (#3924)

Issues.Title: Vs crash and restart when select Form/all controls in the properties windows
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version:
 .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.23 

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

* More info
  1.  **This is a regression issue**, it recurs when installing .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.23 from https://github.com/dotnet/installer and app targets to .NET 5.0.
  2. This issue cannot reproduce on .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20464.22 build.
  3. This issue cannot reproduce on VS comes with .NET 5.0 rc1 and   app target .NET 3.1.

**Problem description:**
When select Form1 in the  properties windows, vs crash and restart.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56664234/93310983-00976400-f838-11ea-8aec-af9103047a1b.png)
![selectForm1_VS_crash_restart](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56664234/93311016-0ab96280-f838-11ea-8a63-2985af8eb8a7.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
When select Form1 in the  properties windows, vs works well and does't crash and restart.

**Minimal repro:**
The repro step is very simple, just create an empty app.
1. Create a WinForms .Net Core application and target .NET 5.0 .
2. Focus on Form designer, and go to Properties window or press F4.
3. Select Form1 in the upper part of the properties windows.
**Call stack:** 
[Call Stack.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5230861/Call.Stack.txt)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vs crash and restart when select Form/all controls in the properties windows" (#3922)

Issues.Title: Properties window is blank after installed latest .NET 5.0 SDK
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 
.NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.34

![dll](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/93310626-9da5cd00-f837-11ea-87d1-2b299d308aad.png)


* More info:
This is a regression issue, it cannot reproduce on .NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20464.22 build.
![GoodDll](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/93318068-d0a08e80-f840-11ea-9664-8c9368b567aa.png)

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**Problem description:**
Properties window is blank, we cannot see any properties for form or added controls, and no properties and events toolbar in Properties window.
![blankIssue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/93310646-a1395400-f837-11ea-8730-6deef0a6031f.png)

**Expected behavior:**
All properties and events are in Properties window.
![Correctly](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/93310658-a4344480-f837-11ea-9415-ae1444847800.png)

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create a WinForms .Net Core application and change the targetFramework to .NET 5.0.
2. Focus on Form designer, and go to Properties window or press F4.
3. Observe **Properties** window.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Properties window is blank after installed latest .NET 5.0 SDK" (#3921)

Resolves #3932

- `DataGridView` serialization is correctly emitted by the designer

## Regression?

Issues.Title: Typo in DataGridViewRowConverter causes CodeDom serialization to fail for DataGridView
Issues.Body:
The code below has a typo where `DataGridView` is used instead of `DataGridViewRow`.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/2ae45c66fdcb8e6aadf43288b7429f17f1fd0f49/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/DataGridViewRowConverter.cs#L33-L40
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Typo in DataGridViewRowConverter causes CodeDom serialization to fail for DataGridView" (#3932)

Issues.Title: Fix PaintEventArgs Graphics property (#3913)
Issues.Body:
#### Port #3913 to RC2 branch

Move the shared logic to a class from a struct to avoid working on a copy of the nested data.

Fixes #3910


## Proposed changes

- Change shared logic container from struct to class

## Customer Impact

- Without this, the Graphics object is always recreated when the args are created from an HDC
- Modifcations to the Graphics object are never retained

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Low, changing to a class avoids copies

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Add specific test to make sure we're retaining the right instance on an args created from an HDC

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/3916)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix PaintEventArgs Graphics property (#3913)" (#3916)

Issues.Title: Adding access to page buttons on PrintPreviewDialog by keyboard shortcut keys
Issues.Body:
Fixes #3682


## Proposed changes

- Adding support of keyboard shortcut keys for access to page buttons on PrintPreviewDialog

## Customer Impact
- The user will be able to switch between viewing modes using the shortcut keys (Ctrl+1, Ctrl+2, etc) on PrintPreviewDialog

## Regression? 

-  No

## Risk

- Minimal

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual testing

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->
- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19041.388]
- NET Core 5.0.100-rc.1.20420.14

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] In the editing state, Accessibility Insights is not responding when just select DataGridViewTextBoxCell
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.2.20465.23

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More Info:**
This issue cannot reproduce on Inspect and Narrator.

**Minimal repro:**

1. Open the attached [WinFormsApp2.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5231054/WinFormsApp2.zip) application in VS, then build and run it.
2. Enter text into Column1(eg: winforms).
3. Open Accessibility Insights and focus on the Column1.
4. Observe Accessibility Insights.

**Expected behavior:**
Accessibility Insights is working.
![Issue2steps1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/93316486-d5fcd980-f83e-11ea-8abb-f44ef23dcbab.gif)

**Actual behavior:**
Accessibility Insights is not responding.
![Issue2steps](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/93316495-d7c69d00-f83e-11ea-8404-80c0aa37677f.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] In the editing state, Accessibility Insights is not responding when just select DataGridViewTextBoxCell" (#3925)

Issues.Body:

- Update SDK/toolset to allow building the solution in VS 16.8
- Auto fix dead warnings
- Suppress new warnings (to be resolved later):
    * CA1837 // Use 'Environment.ProcessId'
    * CA1838 // Avoid 'StringBuilder' parameters for P/Invokes

## Customer Impact

Issues.Title: Flaky test: `Button_Default_WithText_LineDrawing` crashed with System.AccessViolationException
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 

release/5.0-RC2


**Problem description:**

Build: https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/public/_build/results?buildId=817037&view=results


```
Fatal error. System.AccessViolationException: Attempted to read or write protected memory. This is often an indication that other memory is corrupt.
Repeat 2 times:
--------------------------------
   at Interop+User32.FillRect(HDC, RECT ByRef, HBRUSH)
--------------------------------
   at System.Windows.Forms.DeviceContextExtensions.FillRectangle(HDC, System.Drawing.Rectangle, HBRUSH)
```

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Flaky test: `Button_Default_WithText_LineDrawing` crashed with System.AccessViolationException" (#3918)

Issues.Title: Bump SDK/toolset to RC1
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Update SDK/toolset to allow building the solution in VS 16.8
- Auto fix dead warnings
- Suppress new warnings (to be resolved in the master branch):
    * CA1837 // Use 'Environment.ProcessId'
    * CA1838 // Avoid 'StringBuilder' parameters for P/Invokes

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- None - infra changes

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Bump SDK/toolset to RC1" (#3917)
